title: Data Analysis and Visualizations of Global Carbon Emissions
2  Data
text:
2.1.1 Data Sources
Website: The World Bank Group
To analyze country-wise CO2 emissions, various metrics that influence and correlate with CO2 release have been considered. The dataset includes information on forest area percentage, fossil fuel consumption percentage, trade metrics (imports and exports), livestock production, and air pollution levels. Additionally, data on countries’ income levels, GDP, and renewable energy usage has been gathered to examine the factors and trends contributing to CO2 emissions.
The raw data from the World Bank Group website was downloaded as CSV files.
Data Links:

CO2 Emissions (megatonnes)
Forest Area (% of land area)
Fossil Fuel Energy Consumption (% of total energy consumption by country)
Imports of Goods and Services (US dollars)
Exports of Goods and Services (US dollars)
Livestock Production Index (Baseline Index: 100)
Air Pollution (micrograms/m3)
GDP (US dollars)
Renewable Energy Consumption (% of total energy consumption by country)
Income Level: Obtained from the zip folder as a separate CSV file after downloading the data (Low, Lower middle, Upper middle, High)



2.1.2 Data Preprocessing
After importing the data:

The columns are filtered to only include data from years 1990 - 2020
The data frames are converted to long format
All metrics data frames are joined on ‘Country Codes’ to obtain the final dataset
The data frame is exported as a CSV file

Link to Preprocessing script on Python
